{{infobox character | people=[[Hobbits|Hobbit]] | name=Gorhendad Oldbuck | image= | caption= | pronun= | othernames=Ogmandab Zaragamba | titles=[[Thain]]
[[Master of Buckland]] | position= | location=[[Marish]]
[[Brandy Hall]], [[Buckland]] | affiliation= | language= | birth= | birthlocation= | rule=until {{SR|740}} (Thain)
from {{SR|740}} (Master) | death= | deathlocation= | age= | notablefor= | family=[[Brandybuck Family|Brandybuck]] | parentage= | siblings= | spouse= | children= | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Gorhendad Oldbuck''' was a [[Hobbit]] of [[the Shire]], the founder of [[Buckland]] and of the [[Brandybuck Family|Brandybuck]] family. ==History== Gorhendad Oldbuck of the [[Marish]] crossed the [[Brandywine]] in {{TA|2340}}{{App|TA}}, entry for the year 2340, p. 1087 ({{SR|740}}{{App|Brandybuck}}) and founded [[Buckland]] and constructed [[Brandy Hall]].{{FR|Conspiracy}}, p. 98 In honour of their new land, he changed his family name from Oldbuck ([[Hobbitish|H.]] ''[[Zaragamba]]''{{App|Translation}}, p. 1138) to [[Brandybuck Family|Brandybuck]] (H. ''[[Brandagamba]]''). He ruled the land as [[Master of Buckland]] and Master of the Hall, virtually a small independent country. After his death, the head of the Brandybuck family became the Master of Buckland{{App|Later}}, entry for the year 1432, p. 1097 and Master of the Hall. When he and his family moved from [[the Shire]] to Buckland, the office of [[Thain]] passed from the Oldbuck family to the [[Took Family]]{{FR|Ordering}}, p. 9 and [[Isumbras Took I]] became the first [[Thain]] of the Tooks. ==Etymology== ''Gorhendad'' is the translation of [[Westron]] ''Ogmandab''.{{PM|Languages}}, note 8. According to Stoor tradition, it used to mean "great-grandfather" or "ancestor".{{PM|Languages}}, typescript F 4, text 'A' of the second section In an earlier manuscript version the Westron name was ''Ogforgad''. J.R.R. Tolkien mentioned that he gave the name ''Gorhendad'' a "Celtic cast" and that the relation of Welsh or British to English was somewhat similar to the relation of the older language of the Stoors and Bree-men to Westron. He stated that ''Gorhendad'' is a "Welsh word meaning 'great-grandfather'".{{HM|N}}, entry '''Oldbuck''', p. 761{{HM|RC}}, p. 115[[Mark T. Hooker]], ''[[A Tolkienian Mathomium]]'', p. 10 {{references}} {{seq-start}} {{seq-head | race=hobbit | house=[[Brandybuck Family]] | born=Before {{SR|740}} | died=After {{SR|740}} }} {{Seq | pvac=Unknown | prev=Last known:
